source.raw_text:
The Goblet Squat Curl Combo is a full-body exercise combining a goblet squat with bicep curls at the bottom, powerfully working lower body (glutes, quads, hamstrings, calves) and core for stability, while the curl adds biceps, forearms, and traps, with the movement pattern being a deep squat followed by a controlled curl and return, enhancing hip/ankle mobility and strength through a fluid motion. [1, 2, 3, 4]  
Muscles Worked: 

• Primary Lower Body: Glutes, Quadriceps, Hamstrings, Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus). 
• Core & Stability: Rectus Abdominis, Erector Spinae, Obliques (isometric hold). 
• Upper Body (from holding/curling): Biceps, Forearms, Traps, Deltoids, Lats (to keep weight close). [1, 2, 5, 6, 7]  

This video demonstrates the muscles worked during the Goblet Squat Curl: 
Movement Pattern: 

1. Setup: Hold a kettlebell or dumbbell at chest height (goblet position). 
2. Descent: Squat down deeply, keeping your chest up, back straight, and elbows inside your knees to push them out. 
3. Curl: At the bottom, lower the weight straight down as you extend your arms, then curl it back up to the goblet position. 
4. Ascent: Drive up through your heels, squeezing your glutes, returning to standing. 
5. Repetition: This whole sequence (squat + curl) is one repetition, performed fluidly. [1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 9, 10]  

Watch this video to see the correct form for the Goblet Squat Curl: 
Key Benefits: 

• Total Body Strength: Excellent compound exercise for legs, core, and arms. 
• Mobility: Deep squats improve hip, ankle, and thoracic spine mobility. 
• Form Correction: Front-loading and the curl help maintain an upright torso, preventing forward lean. [4, 5, 11, 12, 13]
